thesis.description: <<Arthrobacter citreus>> grew at 25° C in a glucose-salts medium supplemented with 1% (w/v) Difco Casamino Acids and thiamine hydrochloride (0.2 )µg/ml), but growth was characterized by a long lag phase. The lag could not be reduced by supplementation with purines, pyrimidines or ashed trypticase soy broth. Subsequently, it was found that the addition to the medium of various sideramines (iron-transporting growth factors) shortened the lag phase and increased the total cell crop. The sideramine requirement could be replaced by a number of chelating agents. It is postulated that these chelating agents may play a role in iron transport. Sodium chloride (up to 0.1 M) stimulated growth of A. citreus, but the nature of this stimulation has not been investigated. The vitamins and amino acids required for optimal growth of A. citreus at 25° C have been determined to be thiamine, biotin, nicotinic acid, tyrosine, cystine, methionine and glutamic acid.
thesis.creator: Seidman, Phyllis E.
thesis.subject: Microbiology and Immunology.
thesis.title: Growth of <<Arthrobacter citreus>> in a chemically-defined medium
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The results of nutritional investigations made on head lettuce are presented. Sand cultures involving the use of twenty-seven different nutrient solutions, including three levels of nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium, and their various combinations, were used. Certain of these treatments were selected and subjected to continuous illumination. Yield records of tops, trimmed heads, and roots, based on green weight and oven-dried weight values, were tabulated and analyzed statistically. Observations on development of tipburn were examined. It was shown that increasing the nitrogen concentration produced increases in yield up to a critical level, beyond which a deleterious effect was noted. Over a wide range of concentrations, additional phosphorus gave continued increases in yield. Additional potassium did not have a significantly positive effect on yield. In the tipburn studies, high levels of nutrients encouraged burning. Nitrogen appears to be the most important single element. Practically all the burning took place in darkness. Abnormal respiration is offered as a possible explanation for the physiology of tipburn.
thesis.creator: Chan, Allan Poy.
thesis.subject: Horticulture-Botany.
thesis.title: Mineral nutritional effects on head lettuce.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The dissociation of two heme protein, chick hemoglobin and bovine liver catalase has been studied in presence of ionic (LiCl, NaCl, KCl and CaCl2) and non-ionic solutes (formamide, urea, guanidine-hydrochloride and 2-chloroethanol), and in the alkaline pH range of pH 8.0 – pH 11.6. The extent of dissociation depends on the nature of the solvent media. At a low protein concentration bovine catalase dissociates.
thesis.creator: Sawh, Vijay L.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Studies on association-dissociation phenomena of heme-proteins
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Manganese is widely distributed in soil. It occurs in all soils, though usually in low concentrations, and is found in deposits as the ore, pyrolusite. Analyses of plants (25, 33, 37, 39, 40, 44) show that it is absorbed by them and stored in the leaves and in the germ and pericarp of the seeds. That plants absorb manganese has been known since Scheele’s work in 1774, but recently it has been shown that different quantities will be absorbed under changing conditions (17,52); that the amounts absorbed will differ with various stages in the development of the plant (68); and, that the amounts required by different species will vary (36,37). Many workers (1,7,10,13,16,18,20,22,23,24,29,34,35, 37,40,41,42,43,45,54,55,57,58,60,63,75) have shown that manganese in certain concentrations stimulates the growth of higher plants, yeasts, and fungi; that to obtain maximal growth it must not be omitted from the nutrient solution; and that it cannot be replaced by any other element. [...]
thesis.creator: Chaplin, Charles Eric.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Bacteriology.
thesis.title: The microflora of the rhizosphere with special reference to the oxidation of manganese.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: <<Arthrobacter globiformis>> strain 425 is known to require preformed biotin for maximum growth and normal morphological development. Characteristic morphological changes during biotin-sufficient growth are interrupted in biotin-deficient medium, where cells become grossly aberrant. The minimum amount of biotin required for normal growth and morphology was found to be 0.08 - 0.4 mug/ml in a chemically-defined medium. Morphological changes associated with biotin-nutrition were followed by light and electron microscopy. The aberrant form consisted of several protoplasts within a thick matrix, quite unlike the single-celled form of the organism. The matrix may consist of unpolymerized cell wall precursors or components. These protoplasts appeared to develop from division in the absence of normal cell wall synthesis. Both cell types resisted Iysis by osmotic shock but the aberrant forms demonstrated greater resistance to destruction by sonication. This could be attributed to the external matrix which may absorb the shock of ultrasonic treatment.
thesis.creator: Robertson, Janet A.
thesis.subject: Microbiology and Immunology.
thesis.title: The physiological response of <<Arthrobacter globiformis>> to biotin deficiency
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The germ, or embryo, of cereal grains is the part of the berry from which the new plant develops. In wheat the germ is readily distinguished as the small wrinkled portion of the grain on the opposite side of the crease. It makes up about 1.2 percent of the weight of wheat. Structurally, the scutellum is closely associated with the germ, both being separated from the endosperm by a layer of compressed cells, the hyaline layer. The scutellum and embryo together make up about 2.7 percent of the weight of the wheat kernel (27). Bailey (7) reports 2.23 percent in hard wheat. The embryo consists essentially of a plumule and a radicle portion, which become the leaves and roots respectively, of the new plant. Many analyses of wheat germ are to be found in the literature. Frequently, however, the source of the germ is not specified, nor is the degree of contamination with non-germ portions of the wheat indicated. Dissection of the wheat manually would be the ideal method of preparing samples, but this has not generally been undertaken, although Hinton has resorted to this method (27). Germ as produced by ordinary methods of milling contains a certain amount of the scutellum. It is always contaminated with some bran, although this may be reduced to a relatively low figure by careful screening and aspirating. [...]
thesis.creator: Collins, Vernon K.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: Chemical changes in the lipid fraction of wheat germ during storage.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Unilateral brain-damaged adults with hemiplegia were given a series of verbal and non-verbal written stimuli and their copying responses were quantitatively scored according to five separate criteria by two independent judges. It was hypothesized that patients with left hemisphere lesions (right hemiplegia and aphasia) would be most deficient in verbal copying and that patients with right hemisphere lesions (left hemiplegia) would be most deficient in non-verbal copying. There were no significant differences between left hemiplegics without aphasia and right hemiplegics with aphasia. The copying of block capital letters was easiest and the less familiar geometric shapes most difficult for both, groups. The results suggest that in a copying task the verbal aspect of a verbal stimulus is reduced or eliminated, and support the findings of certain previous investigators in showing that brain-damaged patients with left- and right-hemisphere les ions did not differ quantitatively in the copying of non-verbal figures.
thesis.creator: Ridgway, Patricia D.
thesis.subject: Human Communications Disorders.
thesis.title: Analysis of verbal and nonverbal copying abilities in brain-damaged adults
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A general review of the methods of hybrid formation is presented. The properties of an enzyme necessary for the purification of a DNA-RNA hybrid are outlined and the properties of the endonuclease of Neurospora crassa conidia is presented. The purified enzyme degrades single-stranded denatured DNA 50-60 times faster than native DNA and after ageing 6 -8 weeks, the enzyme degrades denatured DNA 200 times faster than native DNA. DNA-RNA hybrid is synthesized using denatured DNA as template and the four nucleoside triphosphates as substrate and then the endonuclease is used to purify the hybrid. Methylated albumin kieselguhr chromatography is used to separate hybrid from degraded DNA. The hybrids were found to be 75% pure. The possibility of using this method for the isolation of specific ribosomal RNA-DNA and- transfer RNA-DNA hybrids is discussed.
thesis.creator: Rabin, Eli Z.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: The use of the endonuclease of Neurospora crassa conidia for the purification and isolation of DNA-RNA hybrids
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Previously it had been shown that an extracellular nephrotoxin, from a Streptococcus pyogenes type 12 strain could induce acute glomerulonephritis in rabbits. The immunosuppressant azathioprine, a purine analog, was administered to the rabbits to see if altered immune response in the animals would affect the course of acute glomerulonephritis. Preliminary experiments were carried out to arrive at a suitable dosage of azathioprine. In a further experiment rabbits received both azathioprine and nephrotoxin. In these animals no kidney lesions developed but hypertension still occurred. Experiments were also conducted in efforts to increase the yield of the nephrotoxin, and to isolate the nephrotoxin as a single polypeptide.
thesis.creator: Ng, Wei-Wei
thesis.subject: Microbiology and Immunology.
thesis.title: Studies on streptococcal nephrotoxin and glomerulonephritis
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In special rocket propellants, burning of the nitro-celluose-nitroglycerine (cordite) tube must be completely restricted to the inside surface of the cordite by applying suitable coatings to the outside surface. Various methyl allyl celluloses containing about 0.5 to 1.5 allyl groups per glucose unit have been prepared from an alkali soluble methylcellulose. Three studied in detail contained 0.70 methyl and 0.79 allyl, or O.59 methyl and 0.95 allyl and 0.59 methyl and 1.47 allyl groups. The solubilities and properties of these substances, together with the acetate and dibromide of the latter, were noted. Methods for estimating the degree of unsaturation of these compounds were worked out including a modified bromide-bromate method. A study of the changes in physical properties of methyl allyl cellulose films, cross-linked by polymerization of the allyl groups, indicated that polymerization, decreased their solubility, flexibility, elongation at break, and moisture vapour permeability, while their tensile strength remained almost constant. Films of the more highly allylated derivative, when polymerized, satisfied the standard test for nitroglycerine barriers.
thesis.creator: Cox, Lionel Audley.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Preparations and properties of methyl allyl cellulose ethers.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: L'histoire d'Hamlet chez Mallarmé commence avec le mythe romantique. Cependant Mallarmé va beaucoup plus loin, en créant un mythe nouveau. Ce mythe comprend trois thèmes majeurs, correspondant à trois phases importantes dans l'oeuvre de Mallarmé. Le thème de l'histrion, visible depuis la période parnassienne (1862-66), exprime d'abord la crise centrale du mythe: "l'antagonisme de rêve chez l'homme avec les fatalités h son existence départies par le Malheur”. Le thème de l'orphelin, qui correspond à la période d'Igitur (1869), manifeste une volonté de dépassement de cet antagonisme. Le mythe ne pourrait exister sans cet espoir de dépassement. C'est pourquoi, enfin, le thème du théatre, exposé dans divers écritsh partir de 1886, vient suggérer la nécessité de fonder en réalité ce rêve d'Hamlet. Or au terme de cette dernière phase l'antagonisme du Rêve et du Hasard s'avère irréductible; tout espoir est vain, c'est ce que révèle le poème, Un coup de dés, qui annonce ainsi la fin du mythe.
thesis.creator: Michon, Jacques
thesis.subject: French.
thesis.title: Du mythe d’Hamlet dans l’oeuvre de Stephane Mallarmé
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Religious developments in the later seventeenth century form, by common consent, a neglected phase of English history. Changes of many kinds affected the Church of England during this period. Regarding most of them I have nothing to say. I have deliberately restricted myself to changes in thought, and the subtitle of this thesis indicates its scope and purpose. I have said nothing about the organized life of the church, or about its government or liturgy. I have even avoided any mention of the change in the favoured style of preaching, though this is closely related to the thought of the Restoration period. I have not discussed the ways in which the ministry of the church was recruited, nor the question of the social position of its clergy. I have not attempted to assess the influence it exercised, though it is nearly a century since Macaulay pointed out that the pulpit was one of the formative of all forces moulding public opinion. The limitation to changes in thought has consequently been deliberate; only a self-imposed restriction of this kind could keep the study within manageable bounds. At the same time, it is necessary to point out that the thesis is not concerned with the history of religious thought in general, but only with those aspects of it wherein changes can clearly be discerned. Consequently, the relatively static forms of Anglican theology have been ignored. [...]
thesis.creator: Cragg, Gerald R. (Gerald Robertson)
thesis.subject: England -- Intellectual life -- 17th century.
Church of England.
England -- Church history -- 17th century.
thesis.title: The church and transition : a study of changes in religious thought in the Church of England, 1660 to 1695.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Incorporation of 1-14C glucose into 14CO2 , GG, and FA in human adipose tissue in vitro has been investigated. Insulin enhanced glucose metabolism by all the tissue specimens studied. A mixed meal increased the basal lipogenesis (due to endogenous insulin release) but did not affect the maximum potential of lipogenesis under insulin stimulation. In omental specimens of adipose tissue obtained from normal adults, basal activity correlated with tissue glucose metabolism under insulin stimulation. Age, obesity and tissue FFA did not substantially alter glucose metabolism by the tissue. Glycerol release was increased under insulin stimulation in the presence of glucose in the medium. The amount of glucose incorporated into FA was lower than its oxidation into CO2.
thesis.creator: Mellati, Ali M.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Lipid metabolism in human adipose tissue
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The effects of the purine analog 8-azaguanine on the hormonal induction of hepatic tyrosine transaminase have been investigated. 8-Azaguanine inhibits incorporation of radioactive amino acids into hepatic protein by 60%, but does not prevent induction of tyrosine transaminase. The enzyme is induced in intact but not in adrenalectomized rats by 8-azaguanine administered in the absence of exogenous hormone; this effect appeared to be non-specific, and is probably due to endogenous corticosteroids produced in response to stress.
thesis.creator: Levitan, Irwin B.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Azaguanine-modified regulation of tyrosine transaminase
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Le problème des nullités forme, au dedans des cadres classiques, une partie très importante de la théorie des obligations, et, sous ce caractère, elle a été etudiéeet approfondie par tous les grands commentateurs. Hais le problème ne semble pas susceptible de donner lieu a une théorie générale sur le Droit, et comme cette étude a pris ce point de vue, il est nécessaire de la justifier. L’investigateur qui désire s’approcher d’une question juridique avec le but de connaître la vérité, doit se dépouiller de toutes ses préventions; il commencera par poser ses prémisses, qui ne sont pas autres que celles que tout homme connaît: la société et le Droit. Cela fait, il analysera le Droit, distinguera ses éléments techniques et rationnels, et fixera, parmi les premiers, l’acte juridique. Avec l’acte juridique l’ouvrage se place, déjà, a une grande distance de la position traditionnelle, qui ne parvint jamais à dégager clairement la notion d’acte juridique; elle l’a confondu avec le contrat, rendant impossible une théorie consistante sur les nullités. C’est l’analyse de l’acte qui constitue la seconde étape, car, comment saura-t-on ce qu’est un acte juridique nul si on ignore l’acte juridique valable? L’analyse a été étendue suffisamment afin de comprendre toute la théorie de l’acte juridique [...]
thesis.creator: Cuevas Cancino, Francisco.
thesis.subject: Liability (Law)
Obligations (Law)
Nullity.
thesis.title: La nullite des actes juridiques.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of this study was to identify the receptors in rabbit atria that mediate the interactions of sympathomimetic drugs and adrenergic blocking drugs on contractility and rate. Effects were compared on right and left atria and the main emphasis was put on phenylephrine as a means of identifying α-receptors. Propranolol, a β-adrenergic blocking drug, was found to inhibit the effects of phenylephrine on rate of the rabbit atrium and on contractility of the rabbit right atrium. Propranolol did not inhibit the inotropic effects of phenylephrine on the left atrium. Inotropic effects of phenylephrine on rabbit right and left atrial preparations were inhibited by the α-adrenergic blocking drugs, phentolamine and phenoxybenzamine. It is concluded that the effect of phenylephrine on rate of the rabbit atrium is mediated by β-receptors only. The effect of phenylephrine on contractility of the right atrium is mediated by both β- and α-receptors. The effect of phenylephrine on contractility of the left atrium is predominantly mediated by α-receptors.
thesis.creator: Leong, Lillian S.
thesis.subject: Pharmacology.
thesis.title: Interactions of sympathomimetic drugs and adrenergic blocking drugs on the rabbit isolated atrium
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The aim of this study was to examine the reagin specificity in passive sensitization of monkey lung tissue with human atopic serum. For this purpose, a monkey lung fragment technique was modified to incorporate the use of suspensions of lung tissue for passive sensitization. Serum fractions prepared by DEAE-Sephadex and Sephadex G-200 chromatography of ragweed allergic sera were compared by hemagglutinating, Prausnitz-Kustner (P-K) and in vitro monkey lung suspension techniques. The results demonstrated a close correlation between the results of assays by P-K and in vitro anaphylaxis techniques. No relationship was observed between hemagglutination and either of the biological assay methods. The results provided evidence that passive sensitization of monkey lung tissue was mediated by human reaginic antibodies.
thesis.creator: Leong, Amy M-Y.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Reagin specificity in passive sensitization of monkey lung suspensions
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Cette thèse concerne l’étude critique de la traduction anglaise du livre “le six octobre”, premier volume de “Les Hommes de Bonne Volonté”, de Jules Romains. On a cherché à déterminer avec quelle exactitude la traduction rend la valeur des oeuvres de Romains et avec quelle fidélité l’atmosphère du roman français est rendue pour le lecteur américain. Cette étude a été provoquée d’abord par un cours de stylistique qui attire l’attention sur la vie mouvante et changeante des langues modernes. On trouve intéressantes les différences de valeur de deux “synonymes” dans deux langues modernes, les expressions qui se disent dans une langue et pas dans une autre, les termes archaïques d’une langue qui sont usuels dans une autre -- tout cela pose la question de la connaissance de la langue étrangère que les traducteurs américains doivent posséder pour leur travail. [...]
thesis.creator: Culver, Eleanor Augusta.
thesis.subject: Romains, Jules, 1885-1972 -- Translations -- History.
Romains, Jules, 1885-1972. Hommes de bonne volonté.
thesis.title: Etude critique de la traduction anglaises du livre de Jules Romains, "Le six octobre" (premier volume de "Les hommes de bonne volonté").
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The literature concerning the identification of choline esters was reviewed and criticized. Part of the work discussed in the is study was to investigate this problem and to show whether or not the biological activity associated with rat brain tissue is due solely to acetylcholine. It was suggested that acetyl-I-carnitylcholine could play a role in nerve metalolism. The cholinergic potency of synthetic acetyl-I-carnitylcholine was measured on the guinea pig ileum preparation and it was found to be one half as active as acetyl choline when determined by two procedures (i) “one-point" assay (ii) "multipoint" assay. Moreover, the index of discrimination for acetyl-I-carnitylcholine was unity on the guinea pig ileum and frog rectus preparations (muscarinic and nicotinic respectively). The "multipoint" assay was used to determine the effects of mixtures of acetylcholine and acetyl-I-carnitylcholine on a biological assay and it was concluded that potentiation of the acetylcholine activity occurred when these two substances were combined.
thesis.creator: Kato, Ann C.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Some properties of acetyl-1-carnitylcholine in brain tissue extracts
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: An inquiry into the chemical nature of the vegetation that surrounds us readily reveals that cellulose is the cheapest and one of the most abundant parts of the organic matter built up by the green plants. Cellulose, especially when associated with lignin, makes up the bulk of the common feedstuffs supplied to cattle in the form of hay, straw and grain. None of the mammals is known, however, to produce an enzyme that will change cellulose and lignin into soluble compounds, but among the microbial associates of many animals are found, in some parts of the digestive tract, forms that can produce enzymes that attack these substances and prepare them for absorption through the blood stream. The close relationship existing between ruminant digestion and bacterial activity gives a strong indication that the nutrition of the ruminant animal is vitally linked with various products derived from bacterial metabolism. [...]The questions of prime interest [...]: 1. What are the agents responsible for the cellulose decomposition in the rumen? 2. What is their mode of action? 3. What are the end-products derived from their action? 4. Of what use to the ruminant animal is the cellulose attacked by the bacteria of the rumen? It is only with the elucidation of these problems that advances will be made in the field of ruminant nutrition and in the full appreciation of the important role played by the microflora of the rumen.
thesis.creator: Dussault, Henri Paul.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Bacteriology.
thesis.title: A study of the microflora of sheep's rumen with special reference to cellulose-decomposing bacteria.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A microdissection technique has been adapted to the investigation of enzyme histochemistry of peripheral nerve. The results have been compared with those obtained using frozen tissue sections, and advantages and disadvantages of the methods discussed. Enzymes investigated were, adenosine triphosphatase, succinic and lactic dehydrogenase, acid phosphatase and the cholinesterases. Because of the question of false localization, particularly at the node of Ranvier, two different histochemical methods were used (and compared) for acid phosphatase and adenosine triphosphatase, and some new observations of enzyme, activity in this area have been discussed. It has been concluded that the microdissection method is a particularly useful technique for peripheral nerve enzyme histochemistry, and some further possible applications of the method have been suggested.
thesis.creator: Kalyanaraman, Uma P.
thesis.subject: Pathology.
thesis.title: Peripheral nerve histochemistry using microdissection
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The effect of glucose administration on hepatic glycogen, mobilization was studied. Sixty full term Wistar rats spontaneously delivered from 12 mothers were used, forty were given intraperitoneal injections of either 5% or 20% glucose at birth and at 2 hourly intervals up to 12 hours; the remaining animals served as controls. They were killed in groups at birth or at 6 to 12 hours postnatally. Liver tissue was obtained for electron microscopy and for chemical determinations of glycogen. In untreated controls the enormous hepatic glycogen store present at birth were almost totally mobilized by 12 hours. In treated rats the glycogen stores persisted and appeared undisturbed electron microscopically. The large increase in endoplasmic reticulum and in Golgi zones seen in controls was not observed in treated rats. Cytolysome formation was delayed. The hepatic fine structure of glucose treated rats at 6 and 12 hours was almost identical to that seen in normal rats at birth. Glucose administration results not only in the persistence of large hepatic glycogen stores but delays the normal developmental changes in the endoplasmic reticulum and other organelles as well.
thesis.creator: Ho, Joana C.
thesis.subject: Pathology.
thesis.title: An ultrastructural study of the effects of parenteral glucose on hepatic glycogen mobilization
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This research was conducted in Port-of-Spain, Trinidad. A sociometric test was given to 40 boys and 49 girls, who comprised three multiracial groups - Cubs and Brownies. This test was designed to show the degree of social interaction among racial subgroups. Results showed that the boys’ group tended toward racial self-preference; whereas, the girls' choices were fairly well distributed, although most were directed to the most prestigious subgroup. The mothers of these children (N=68) were also interviewed to elicit their views on Trinidadian race relations. Three major findings emerged: (1) the urban situation has tended to erase the acute rivalry among racial groups which may still exist in the rural areas; (2) politics in recent years have increased the rift between the East Indians and the Negroes, and between the Whites and the Negroes; (3) within all the racial categories, social class is a more important variable than racial origin in influencing interpersonal interaction.
thesis.creator: Garstang, Patricia M.
thesis.subject: Anthropology.
thesis.title: Social interaction patterns and values of children and their mothers in a multiracial society
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Serum from a markedly wheat-sensitive patient was studied and found to contain a high titer of reasinic antibody (1:10,000). Of particular interest was the finding that P-K sites responded to both oral and intradermal challenge. Of the wheat allergens studied, α-gliadin appeared to be the most important in terms of potency as determined by wheal and flare it elicited and by its ability to neutralize regain in vitro.
thesis.creator: Goldstein, Gerald B.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Study of serum antibodies in a subject with marked hypersensitivity to gliadin
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The work described in this thesis presents data which shows that the steroid glycoside alkaloids (Tomatine and Gomatine) recently isolated from crown gall infected tomato stalks exert anti-inflammatory activity in experimental animals. The oral or parenteral administration of Tomatine one hour prior to injecting carrageenan into rat hind paws significantly inhibited paw swelling in both intact and adrenalectomized animals.
thesis.creator: Filderman, Ronald B.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: The anti-inflammatory action of some steroid glycoside alkaloids isolated from crown gall tumors
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
